MKP-1 plays a critical role in regulation of cytokine expression upon mycobacterial infection. in this scenario, LPS activates MKP-1, which in turn dephosphorylates and deactivates phospho-p38 MAPK, resulting in less TNF- induction. DUSP2 behaves differently from other MKP family members. in DUSP2 KO macrophages treated with LPS, they produced less inflammatory mediators including less TNF, IL-6, nitric oxide, and IL-12-producing cells. it is plausible that these unexpected positive regulations of immune cell functions by DUSP2 were due to crosstalks between MAPKs [13] in this case, BCG induces MKP-1 expression while also activates MAPKs including p38 MAPK and ERK1/2. the unknown factor in turn inhibits MAPKs activation, which ultimately leads to more TNF- induction. plasma was removed and incubated at 56°C for 30 minutes. it was quickly chilled on ice and centrifuged at 3000 r.p.m. for 10 minutes. supernatant was then filtered through syringe filter and used as autologous plasma. RNA was precipitated from aqueous phase by mixing with one volume of isopropyl alcohol at room temperature for 10 minutes. the supernatant was removed and the RNA pellet was dried in air for 10 minutes. each RNA sample was dissolved in DEPC-water mixed with RNase inhibitor. PCR products were analyzed on a 1% agarose gel with ethidium bromide. the product was stored at -20°C until use for PCR and QPCR assays. RNA as well as reference gene GAPDH were assayed by the gene-specific Assays-on-Demand reagent kits. all samples were run in duplicates or triplicates and with no template controls on an ABI Prism 7700 Sequence Detector. the relative gene expression of the targeted genes was calculated as 2-CT. antibodies for Actin, MKP-1 (Santa Cruz Biotech., USA), phospho-p38 MAPK, phospho-ERK1/2 (Cell Signaling, USA) were detected using the Enhanced Chemiluminescence System (Amersham Pharmacia Biotech) as per the manufacturer's instructions. Isolation of PBMo was isolated from buffy coats of healthy blood donors. the cells were centrifuged at 3000 r.p.m. for 15 minutes and separated into plasma and cell layers. plasma was removed and centrifuged at 3000 r.p.m. for 10 minutes. the cells were lysed in TRIzol reagent at room temperature for 5 minutes. the tube was vigorously shaken for 15 seconds and incubated at room temperature for 3 minutes. the sample was centrifuged again at 4°C for 10 minutes at 13,200 r.p.m. first-strand cDNA was reverse-transcribed in a 20 l reaction. the product was heated at 70°C for 10 minutes and chilled quickly on ice. PCR assays contained 5 pmol of each upstream and downstream primer. PCR products were analyzed on a 1% agarose gel with ethidium bromide. the levels of MKP-1, and TNF- mRNA as well as reference gene GAPDH were assayed by the gene-specific assays-on-Demand reagent kits.
